judgment_text:
IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY
 ORDINARY ORIGINAL CIVIL JURISDICTION
 Misc. Petition NO.553 OF 1986
 Maharashtra State
 Electricity Board. ... Petitioner.
 vs.
 Estrella Batteries Ltd., & ors.... Respondents.
 Miss A. Ghone i/b. M/s. Kanga & Co., for respondent
 no.1
 Mr. K.H. Mody i/b. Little & Co. for MSEB.
 Mr. N.M. Ganguli, for the workmen.
 Ms. Geeta Shastri, ASST. Govt. Pleader for Sales TAx.
 Mr. S.D. Bhonsale for Union of India
 Mr. M.V. Deshmukh , Court Receiver, present.
 CORAM: A.S. Aguiar J.
 Date: 18 /1 /2005
 P.C. :
 Learned advocate for defendant no.1 state that the
 company has taken out chamber summons for deciding
 whether interest on MSEB claim is payable or not.
 Learned advocate Mr. Ganguli for workmen insists
 that the workmen be immediately paid their dues from
 the amount lying with the court Receiver. Learned
 -2-
 advocate Mr.Mody for MSEB states the claim of MSEB is
 to the extent of about Rs.30 lakhs which is the
 entire interest component of the claim on the
 principal amount of Rs.67 lakhs. Learned Advocate
 Ms. Shastri holding for Govt. Pleader prays for
 time since father of Mr. Naik, Advocate appearing
 for Sales Tax Department, has expired.
 S.O. 2 weeks.
 ----
 (A. S. Aguiar J.)
